body.draft-comment: This topic is designed to contains some customization tips.
body.p: There are several ways of customization, depending on the volume of changes you need to apply:

There are several methods you can choose to customize the Webhelp Responsive output. Each method allows you to make a number of customizations and each method has his own limitations. So, you can choose a method depending on your needs.
body.section: Customizing WebHelp Output with a Custom CSS
body.p: There are several ways of customization, depending on the volume of changes you need to apply:

row.entry: Customizing an existing skin using args.css and args.root
You like an existing skin, and is very close to what you need, but is necessary to personalize it.

Use the browser CSS inspector to lookup for CSS classes you need to modify.
Create a css file in your project. Add here your selectors.Use args.css to point to the CSS file you need to include in the output. This will override default styles.

ul.li: The custom CSS can be included in the project.
the fonts, images and other resources must be remote, on a server (TODO: check if args.css.root allows to copy also resources)
Does not appear in the Themes tab in the transformation scenarion, instead it should be set as a parameter.

row.entry: You need some design that is not similar to any of the oXygen predefined skins, or you want to heavily change one of the skins.

entry.p: Locate the DITA-OT you are using. (Look into the preferences for "DITA"). For instance if you are using DITA-OT 2.X, look into the folder:

Here you can see some subdirectories, corresponding to different variants of the same template. For instance:
tiles (the main page contains a section with tiles for each chapter)
tree (the main page contains a section with some expandable tree)
In each variant, you will find a directory with a collection of skins.
Copy the folder of one skin and change the skin.css file.
You can place fonts, images or other resources in the resources folder next to the skin.css file.
Tip: Use a small map for a speedy publishing time. Use the browser CSS inspector to lookup for CSS classes you need to modify.

ul.li: The resources are encapsulated into the skin directory, together with the skin.css
Appears in the transformation scenario dialog Themes tab.
You need access to the installation folder, or to use an external DITA-OT, with the webhelp plugin installed.

row.entry: You need to make significant structural changes, for instance moving some components to other positions, or you want to use a different layout library than Bootstrap (for instance switch to Foundation )

entry.p: Locate the DITA-OT you are using. (Look into the preferences for "DITA"). For instance if you are using DITA-OT 2.X, look into the folder:
Copy the bootstrap folder, clean up the variants directory and keep just one. In that variant, keep just a skin. Modify the .html files, CSS-s, etc.
Tip: Use a small map for a speedy publishing time. Use the browser CSS inspector to lookup for CSS classes you need to modify.

ul.li: You need access to the installation folder, or to use an external DITA-OT, with the webhelp plugin installed.
